Tryptich of Bibles
(or, How to Learn Fields and Influence People)

There are too many textbooks. And how much of these books are nothing more than the same points made in a different way? And what do these different ways count for? A subject can break down into many interdependent parts, framed in many different ways. How do we ensure that we don't miss a beat?

What we want, or at least what I want, in a way that is very much like other things I want, is to minimax books across concept space. As I hoped to show in "Neural Contiguity",
